kyotocabinet::Cursor

Detailed Description

Interface of cursor to indicate a record.

Member Function Documentation

def kyotocabinet::Cursor::disable (   self  ) 

Disable the cursor.

Returns:
always None.
Note:
This method should be called explicitly when the cursor is no longer in use.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::accept (   self,
  visitor,
  writable = True,
  step = False 
)

Accept a visitor to the current record.

Parameters:
visitor a visitor object which implements the Visitor interface, or a function object which receives the key and the value.
writable true for writable operation, or false for read-only operation.
step true to move the cursor to the next record, or false for no move.
Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::set_value (   self,
  value,
  step = False 
)

Set the value of the current record.

Parameters:
value the value.
step true to move the cursor to the next record,
Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::remove (   self  ) 

Remove the current record.

Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
Note:
If no record corresponds to the key, false is returned. The cursor is moved to the next record implicitly.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get_key (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get the key of the current record.

Parameters:
step true to move the cursor to the next record, or false for no move.
Returns:
the key of the current record, or None on failure.
Note:
If the cursor is invalidated, None is returned.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get_key_str (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get the key of the current record.

Note:
Equal to the original Cursor::get_key method except that the return value is unicode.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get_value (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get the value of the current record.

Parameters:
step true to move the cursor to the next record, or false for no move.
Returns:
the value of the current record, or None on failure.
Note:
If the cursor is invalidated, None is returned.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get_value_str (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get the value of the current record.

Note:
Equal to the original Cursor::get_value method except that the return value is unicode.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get a pair of the key and the value of the current record.

Parameters:
step true to move the cursor to the next record, or false for no move.
Returns:
a pair of the key and the value of the current record, or None on failure.
Note:
If the cursor is invalidated, None is returned.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::get_str (   self,
  step = False 
)

Get a pair of the key and the value of the current record.

Note:
Equal to the original Cursor::get_key method except that the return value is unicode.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::jump (   self,
  key = None 
)

Jump the cursor to a record for forward scan.

Parameters:
key the key of the destination record. If it is None, the destination is the first record.
Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::jump_back (   self,
  key = None 
)

Jump the cursor to a record for backward scan.

Parameters:
key the key of the destination record. If it is None, the destination is the last record.
Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
Note:
This method is dedicated to tree databases. Some database types, especially hash databases, will provide a dummy implementation.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::step (   self  ) 

Step the cursor to the next record.

Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
def kyotocabinet::Cursor::step_back (   self  ) 

Step the cursor to the previous record.

Returns:
true on success, or false on failure.
Note:
This method is dedicated to tree databases. Some database types, especially hash databases, may provide a dummy implementation.

Get the database object.

Returns:
the database object.
